title: Luminary Tour: Joseph E. Yoakum—What I Saw
title_display: Luminary Tour: Joseph E. Yoakum—What I Saw
hero_caption: Joseph E. Yoakum. Rain Bow Bridge in Bryce Canyon National Park near Henriville Utah, stamped 1968 Collection of the Roger Brown Study Collection
short_description: Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw.
list_description: Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw.
description:
Connect with fellow Luminary members on a guided small-group tour of Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw. In 1962 at the age of 71, Joseph E. Yoakum reported having a dream that inspired him to draw, and over the next 10 years the retired veteran produced some 2,000 works. This exhibition follows a shifting progression of Yoakum’s mountainous terrain, arid deserts, and majestic waterways, as well as a selection of his portraits of African American icons, testifying to the rich imagination of an exceptional American artist as well as to the remarkable circumstances that led to his lasting legacy.

Open exclusively to Luminary members, this tour requires advance registration and is limited to twelve participants. The tour lasts approximately 50 minutes. View all upcoming Luminary programs.

Physical distancing and other visiting policies must be observed.

Coat and bag check, dining, and valet services are currently unavailable. Find further information on what to expect on our website.

Contact Us

If you have questions or are interested in learning more about Luminary membership, we’d be delighted to hear from you. Please contact us at (312) 443-3735 or luminary@artic.edu.
